diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right lower quadrant abdominal pain that progressed from diffuse and crampy to localized, accompanied by nausea, vomiting, fever, and chills. Physical examination revealed tenderness in the right lower quadrant with positive Rovsing's sign. An ultrasound confirmed the presence of a noncompressible, blind-ending tubular structure consistent with an inflamed appendix and appendicolith, along with free fluid in the right lower quadrant.
